alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Wayne (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 7:17PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WESTERN WAYNE AND FAYETTE COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM EDT... At 717 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Dublin, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Connersville, Centerville, Cambridge City, Hagerstown, Dublin, Glenwood, Waterloo, Columbia, Bunker Hill, Greens Fork, East Germantown, Mount Auburn, Alquina, Mettel Field, Jacksonburg, Nulltown, Bentonville, Beesons and Springersville. This includes I-70 in Indiana between mile markers 134 and 145. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for east central Indiana. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
